summary: This mod expands upon my Roselia mod by adding another pokemon, Misdreavus, and addressing several problems that limited the combat efficacy of these companions.
descriptionHtml:
Install Directions: just put the .esp in your Data folder, and the Scripts in your
Data/scripts folder, and it should be good to go.

What this mod does:
This is very simple. It adds two \"pokemon\" animal follower, one named Roselia
(she looks like a tiny Spriggan) and the other Misdreavus (looks like a ghostly little girl) at the Drunken
Hunstman in Whiterun. These followesr will learn spells as the player levels up, and will maintain
the four move limit as per pokemon standards. They can also be evolved into Roserade/Mismagius,
who do not learn new moves, but use more powerful versions of the moves they learned 
as Roselia/Misdreavus.

HOW THINGS WORK:
1) Getting Roselia/Misdreavus: Very simple, walk up to them in the Huntsman and say Roselia/Misdreavus, I choose you!
2) Getting new moves: When the player hits a level that Roselia/Misdreavus would learn a move at
 you
can walk up to Roselia/Misdreavus and say \"Hey Roselia/Misdreavus, what\'s up?\" and they will begin her dialogue
for learning a new spell. At this point you will have four slots to choose from
(the first slot is automatically filled by Absorb at the beginning) to fill with the 
new move/spell.
3) Evolving Roselia/Misdreavus - pay 1000 gold to Prof. Hist and Roselia/Misdreavus will automatically
evolve into Roserade/Mismagius. The Shiny Stone is for Roselia and the Dusk Stone for Misdreavus.

CRITICALLY IMPORTANT NOTES:  The dialogues for learning new moves do NOT tell you
what move is being learned, or what moves are alread in what slot. I suggest
writing down what moves are in each slot, as otherwise you may forget the wrong 
move by accident. Also it may be a good idea to keep a copy of the table below on hand. This I believe will not be possible to fix due to the nature of the Kit until the script extender.

Also, make sure you know what levels you will get a new move on, and do not surpass this level before trying to gain a move. Attempting to gain a new move while you are not at the correct level will cause the Pokemon to forget the spell in that slot, but not gain another spell. I am working on this.

Roselia MOVE LIST:
Level   Spell           Effect
Start	Absorb		Absorbs 4 HP/sec
4	Growth		Fortifies Magicka Regen by a factor of 4 for 20 seconds
7	Poison Sting	13 points of damage/sec for 3 seconds
10	Stun Spore	Basically its Unrelenting Force. I can\'t get her to cast this though. Hopefully I can fix this soon.
13	Mega Drain	Absorbs 8 HP/sec
16	Leech Seed	5 points of damage/sec for 100 seconds.
19	Magical Leaf	60 pts of damage
22	GrassWhistle	1 second paralysis (this is better than it sounds, as the one second does not include the time it takes for the enemy to fall down and stand back up again)
25	Giga Drain	Absorbs 16 hp/sec
28	Toxic Spikes	16 Damage/sec for 20 seconds
31	Sweet Scent	3 second paralysis
34	Ingrain		Heals 24 HP/sec for 10 seconds
37	Toxic		60 poison damage/sec for 3 seconds
40	Petal Dance	24 damage/second constant cast spell
43	Aromatherapy	Restores 110 pts of health in an area	
46	Synthesis	Restores Roselia to full health (basically)

MISDREAVUS Move List
Start	Growl - Drains 66 Points of Stamina on Target	
Start	Psywave	- Does 1-3X Player\'s Level (randomly) 80% of the time (at Level 50 Mismagius can do up to 225 damage for 75 mana)
5	Spite	- Drains 50 Points of Magicka
10	Astonish - Deals 30 Damage and has a chance
14	Confuse Ray - Causes a brief Frenzy	
19	Mean Look - Roots the enemy to the ground (by diminishing his carry capacity by 300)	
23	Hex - Deals 50 Damage
28	Psybeam	 - Deals 65 Damage and has a 10% chance of frenzying
32	Pain Split - If the enemy has twice or more the amount of HP as Misdreavus, they both have their health\'s changed to the average
37	Payback	 - Deals 100 Damage
41	Shadow Ball - Deals 80 Damage and has a 20% chance of eliminating magic resistance
46	Perish Song - Kills all Enemies around
50	Power Gem - Deals 70 Damage for a low mana cost


All spells are 1.5 times as powerful when Roselia/Misdreavus evolves into Roserade/Mismagius.

Information about Roselia/Misdreavus:

Roselia is a Grass/Poison type pokemon. More information can be found about them here:
http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/
I used Roselia for a number of reasons, but mostly it was because there was already 
a Skyrim base creature (a Spriggan) that bore a physical resemblance to the pokemon.

Misdreavus is a ghost type pokemon. More info here: http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Misdreavus



they does not evolve as a function of them level, but when given a Shiny Stone.
This can be purchased from Prof. Hist in the Drunken Huntsman. (NOTE: This isn\'t an
actual buyable object, it simply causes a script to run that \'evolves\' Roselia/Misdreavus
into Roserade/Mismagius)

Any help or suggestions for the mod are appreciated, just drop me a message on Skyrim nexus.

CHANGES SINCE ROSELIA:
Pokemon now actually gain stats (skill levels, perks, and values like Health/Magicka) as you level up.
Pokemon moves have a cooldown period, forcing them to use different spells rather than spam one.
Obviously, Misdreavus is now here.
author: Alex Ducey
